root.title: Uyk-Turan (е-3)
root.place: The monument found out near the present Turan city.
root.store: Danzynuly organized replacing the stone to the Tyva museum in Kyzyl in 1943.
root.general: The deer stone is a component of small barrow in Arjan. It belongs to early nomads epoch of bronze (VII-III BC).
root.description: Made from reddish grey clay fine stone. Wild deer and boars are pictured on both sides. There are totally 6 lines of epitaph: 3 lines on two sides. There are half moon and cross formed sign on below of one scripted side.
root.size: Height - 2,82 m, length - 0,19 m, width - 0,41 m.
root.investigation: The stone was found and declared by Funtikov. I.R.Aspelin in 1888, D.A.Klements in 1891, J.G. Granö in 1906, and other scientists conducted researches.
root.details: Н.Базылхан. Көне түрік бітіктастары (Орхон, Енисей, Талас)// "Қазақстан тарихы туралы түркі деректемелері" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.172-173.
